query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Ne l’ora che non può ’l calor dïurno 2 intepidar più ’l freddo de la luna, 3 vinto da terra, e talor da Saturno
4 —quando i geomanti lor Maggior Fortuna 5 veggiono in orïente, innanzi a l’alba, 6 surger per via che poco le sta bruna—,
7 mi venne in sogno una femmina balba, 8 ne li occhi guercia, e sovra i piè distorta, 9 con le man monche, e di colore scialba.
query.result:
**English:**
1 At the hour when the heat of the day 2 can no longer warm the chill of the moon, 3 conquered by the earth, and sometimes by Saturn
4 —when geomancers see their Greater Fortune 5 in the east, before dawn, 6 rising along a path that is slightly dark—,
7 a stammering woman came to me in a dream, 8 squinting in her eyes and twisted in her feet, 9 with mutilated hands and a pale complexion.
**Malay:**
1 Pada waktu ketika panasnya siang hari 2 tidak dapat lagi menghangatkan dinginnya bulan, 3 dikalahkan oleh bumi, dan kadang-kadang oleh Saturnus
4 —ketika ahli geomansi melihat Keberuntungan Utama mereka 5 di timur, sebelum fajar, 6 terbit di sepanjang jalan yang sedikit gelap—,
7 seorang wanita gagap datang kepadaku dalam mimpi, 8 juling di matanya dan bengkok di kakinya, 9 dengan tangan yang buntung dan kulit yang pucat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
10 Io la mirava; e come ’l sol conforta 11 le fredde membra che la notte aggrava, 12 così lo sguardo mio le facea scorta
13 la lingua, e poscia tutta la drizzava 14 in poco d’ora, e lo smarrito volto, 15 com’ amor vuol, così le colorava.
query.result:
**English:**
10 I looked at her; and as the sun comforts 11 the cold limbs that the night weighs down, 12 so my gaze made her escort
13 her tongue, and then straightened her up completely 14 in a short time, and her lost color, 15 as love wills, it colored her thus.
**Malay:**
10 Aku memandangnya; dan sebagaimana matahari menghibur 11 anggota tubuh yang dingin yang malam hari memberatkan, 12 demikianlah pandanganku menjadikannya pengawal
13 lidahnya, dan kemudian menegakkannya sepenuhnya 14 dalam waktu yang singkat, dan wajahnya yang hilang warnanya, 15 sebagaimana cinta menghendaki, demikianlah mewarnainya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 Poi ch’ell’ avea ’l parlar così disciolto, 17 cominciava a cantar sì, che con pena 18 da lei avrei mio intento rivolto.
query.result:
**English:**
16 After she had spoken so freely, 17 she began to sing so sweetly that with difficulty 18 I would have turned my attention away from her.
**Malay:**
16 Setelah dia berbicara dengan begitu bebas, 17 dia mulai bernyanyi dengan begitu merdu sehingga dengan susah payah 18 aku akan mengalihkan perhatianku darinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
19 «Io son», cantava, «io son dolce serena, 20 che ’ marinari in mezzo mar dismago; 21 tanto son di piacere a sentir piena!
22 Io volsi Ulisse del suo cammin vago 23 al canto mio; e qual meco s’ausa, 24 rado sen parte; sì tutto l’appago!».
query.result:
**English:**
19 "I am," she sang, "I am sweet Siren, 20 who bewilder sailors in the middle of the sea; 21 I am so full of pleasure to hear!
22 I turned Ulysses from his wandering path 23 with my song; and whoever dares to be with me, 24 rarely leaves; so much do I satisfy him!"
**Malay:**
19 "Akulah," nyanyinya, "akulah Siren yang manis, 20 yang membingungkan para pelaut di tengah lautan; 21 aku begitu penuh dengan kesenangan untuk didengar!
22 Aku membelokkan Ulysses dari jalannya yang mengembara 23 dengan laguku; dan siapa pun yang berani bersamaku, 24 jarang yang pergi; begitulah aku memuaskannya!".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Ancor non era sua bocca richiusa, 26 quand’ una donna apparve santa e presta 27 lunghesso me per far colei confusa.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Her mouth was not yet closed, 26 when a holy and ready woman appeared 27 beside me to confound her.
**Malay:**
25 Mulutnya belum tertutup, 26 ketika seorang wanita suci dan siap muncul 27 di sampingku untuk mempermalukannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 «O Virgilio, Virgilio, chi è questa?», 29 fieramente dicea; ed el venìa 30 con li occhi fitti pur in quella onesta.
query.result:
**English:**
28 "O Virgil, Virgil, who is this?", 29 he said fiercely; and he came 30 with his eyes fixed only on that virtuous woman.
**Malay:**
28 "Wahai Virgil, Virgil, siapakah dia?", 29 katanya dengan garang; dan dia datang 30 dengan matanya yang terpaku hanya pada wanita yang berbudi luhur itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
31 L’altra prendea, e dinanzi l’apria 32 fendendo i drappi, e mostravami ’l ventre; 33 quel mi svegliò col puzzo che n’uscia.
query.result:
**English:**
31 The other one seized him and in front of me 32 tore open his belly, ripping his clothes; 33 that stench woke me up.
**Malay:**
31 Yang satunya menangkapnya dan di depanku 32 merobek pakaiannya, memperlihatkan perutnya; 33 bau busuk yang keluar dari sana membangunkan aku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 Io mossi li occhi, e ’l buon maestro: «Almen tre 35 voci t’ho messe!», dicea, «Surgi e vieni; 36 troviam l’aperta per la qual tu entre».
query.result:
**English:**
34 I moved my eyes, and the good master: "At least three 35 voices have I given you!", he said, "Rise and come; 36 let us find the opening through which you may enter".
**Malay:**
34 Aku menggerakkan mataku, dan guru yang baik: "Setidaknya tiga 35 suara telah kuberikan padamu!", katanya, "Bangunlah dan mari; 36 mari kita temukan jalan terbuka yang dapat kamu lalui".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 Sù mi levai, e tutti eran già pieni 38 de l’alto dì i giron del sacro monte, 39 e andavam col sol novo a le reni.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Upward I climbed, and all the circles of the sacred mountain 38 were already filled with the high day, 39 and they walked with the new sun at their backs.
**Malay:**
37 Aku memanjat ke atas, dan semua lingkaran gunung suci itu 38 telah dipenuhi oleh siang hari yang tinggi, 39 dan mereka berjalan dengan matahari baru di punggung mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 Con l’ali aperte, che parean di cigno, 47 volseci in sù colui che sì parlonne 48 tra due pareti del duro macigno.
query.result:
**English:**
46 With open wings, that seemed like those of a swan, 47 he turned us upward, he who spoke thus 48 between two walls of hard rock.
**Malay:**
46 Dengan sayap yang terbuka, yang tampak seperti sayap angsa, 47 ia membalikkan kami ke atas, ia yang berbicara demikian 48 di antara dua dinding batu yang keras.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 Mosse le penne poi e ventilonne, 50 ‘Qui lugent’ affermando esser beati, 51 ch’avran di consolar l’anime donne.
query.result:
**English:**
49 Then he moved his wings and fanned them, 50 declaring those who mourn to be blessed, 51 for they shall have the souls of ladies to console them.
**Malay:**
49 Kemudian dia menggerakkan sayapnya dan mengepakkannya, 50 menyatakan bahwa mereka yang berkabung itu diberkati, 51 karena mereka akan memiliki jiwa para wanita untuk menghibur mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 «Che hai che pur inver’ la terra guati?», 53 la guida mia incominciò a dirmi, 54 poco amendue da l’angel sormontati.
query.result:
**English:**
52 "What is the matter with you that you keep staring at the ground?", 53 my guide began to say to me, 54 both of us having just barely climbed over the angel.
**Malay:**
52 "Apa yang salah denganmu sehingga kamu terus menatap tanah?", 53 pemanduku mulai berkata kepadaku, 54 kami berdua baru saja memanjat malaikat itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
55 E io: «Con tanta sospeccion fa irmi 56 novella visïon ch’a sé mi piega, 57 sì ch’io non posso dal pensar partirmi».
query.result:
**English:**
55 And I: "With so much suspicion does it make me 56 a new vision that bends me to itself, 57 so that I cannot depart from thinking about it".
**Malay:**
55 Dan aku: "Dengan begitu banyak kecurigaan, hal itu membuatku 56 penglihatan baru yang membungkuk ke arahku, 57 sehingga aku tidak dapat berhenti memikirkannya".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 «Vedesti», disse, «quell’antica strega 59 che sola sovr’ a noi omai si piagne; 60 vedesti come l’uom da lei si slega.
query.result:
**English:**
58 "You saw," he said, "that ancient sorceress 59 who alone is now bewailed by us; 60 you saw how man is ensnared by her.
**Malay:**
58 "Engkau lihat," katanya, "penyihir tua itu 59 yang sendirian di atas kita sekarang diratapi; 60 engkau lihat bagaimana manusia terjerat olehnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Bastiti, e batti a terra le calcagne; 62 li occhi rivolgi al logoro che gira 63 lo rege etterno con le rote magne».
query.result:
**English:**
61 It is enough, and beat the ground with your heels; 62 turn your eyes to the wretch who goes around 63 the eternal king with the great wheels.
**Malay:**
61 Cukuplah, dan hentakkan tumitmu ke tanah; 62 arahkan matamu ke orang celaka yang berputar-putar 63 mengelilingi raja abadi dengan roda-roda besar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 Quale ’l falcon, che prima a’ pié si mira, 65 indi si volge al grido e si protende 66 per lo disio del pasto che là il tira,
67 tal mi fec’ io; e tal, quanto si fende 68 la roccia per dar via a chi va suso, 69 n’andai infin dove ’l cerchiar si prende.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Like the falcon, who first looks at his feet, 65 then turns to the call and stretches out 66 for the desire of the food that draws him there,
67 so did I; and so, as much as the rock splits 68 to give way to him who goes up, 69 I went until I reached where the circling begins.
**Malay:**
64 Seperti elang, yang pertama melihat kakinya, 65 kemudian berpaling ke panggilan dan menjulurkan tubuhnya 66 karena keinginan akan makanan yang menariknya ke sana,
67 begitulah yang kulakukan; dan begitulah, sebanyak batu yang terbelah 68 untuk memberi jalan kepada orang yang naik ke atas, 69 aku pergi sampai aku mencapai tempat lingkaran itu dimulai.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 Com’ io nel quinto giro fui dischiuso, 71 vidi gente per esso che piangea, 72 giacendo a terra tutta volta in giuso.
query.result:
**English:**
70 As I was released into the fifth circle, 71 I saw people weeping there, 72 lying on the ground, all facing down.
**Malay:**
70 Ketika aku dilepaskan ke dalam lingkaran kelima, 71 aku melihat orang-orang menangis di sana, 72 terbaring di tanah, semuanya menghadap ke bawah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
73 ‘Adhaesit pavimento anima mea’ 74 sentia dir lor con sì alti sospiri, 75 che la parola a pena s’intendea.
query.result:
**English:**
73 My soul clung to the ground 74 I heard them sigh so deeply, 75 that the words were barely understandable.
**Malay:**
73 ‘Adhaesit pavimento anima mea’ 74 aku mendengar mereka mendesah begitu dalam, 75 sehingga kata-katanya nyaris tidak terdengar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 «O eletti di Dio, li cui soffriri 77 e giustizia e speranza fa men duri, 78 drizzate noi verso li alti saliri».
query.result:
**English:**
76 "O chosen of God, whose suffering 77 and justice and hope make you endure, 78 direct us towards the high ascent."
**Malay:**
76 "Wahai orang-orang pilihan Tuhan, yang penderitaannya 77 dan keadilan dan harapan membuatmu kuat, 78 arahkanlah kami menuju pendakian yang tinggi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
79 «Se voi venite dal giacer sicuri, 80 e volete trovar la via più tosto, 81 le vostre destre sien sempre di fori».
query.result:
**English:**
79 "If you come from a place of safety, 80 and you want to find the quickest way, 81 always keep to your right."
**Malay:**
79 "Jika kamu datang dari tempat yang aman, 80 dan kamu ingin menemukan jalan tercepat, 81 selalu belok ke kanan."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
82 Così pregò ’l poeta, e sì risposto 83 poco dinanzi a noi ne fu; per ch’io 84 nel parlare avvisai l’altro nascosto,
85 e volsi li occhi a li occhi al segnor mio: 86 ond’ elli m’assentì con lieto cenno 87 ciò che chiedea la vista del disio.
query.result:
**English:**
82 Thus prayed the poet, and thus was answered 83 a little before us; wherefore I 84 perceived in his speech the other concealed,
85 and turned my eyes to the eyes of my lord: 86 whereupon he assented to me with a glad sign 87 to that which the sight of desire demanded.
**Malay:**
82 Demikianlah penyair itu berdoa, dan demikianlah dijawab 83 sedikit di hadapan kami; oleh karena itu aku 84 memahami dalam ucapannya yang lain tersembunyi,
85 dan memalingkan mataku ke mata tuanku: 86 maka ia menyetujuiku dengan tanda gembira 87 apa yang diminta oleh pandangan keinginan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 Poi ch’io potei di me fare a mio senno, 89 trassimi sovra quella creatura 90 le cui parole pria notar mi fenno,
91 dicendo: «Spirto in cui pianger matura 92 quel sanza ’l quale a Dio tornar non pòssi, 93 sosta un poco per me tua maggior cura.
query.result:
**English:**
88 Then, when I was able to control myself, 89 I turned to that creature 90 whose words had previously made me take note,
91 saying: "Spirit, for whom weeping is appropriate 92 for him without whom you cannot return to God, 93 pause a little for me, your greater concern.
**Malay:**
88 Kemudian, ketika aku dapat mengendalikan diriku, 89 aku berpaling kepada makhluk itu 90 yang kata-katanya sebelumnya telah membuatku memperhatikan,
91 berkata: "Roh, yang untuknya menangis adalah pantas 92 untuk dia yang tanpanya kamu tidak dapat kembali kepada Tuhan, 93 berhentilah sejenak untukku, perhatianmu yang lebih besar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 Chi fosti e perché vòlti avete i dossi 95 al sù, mi dì, e se vuo’ ch’io t’impetri 96 cosa di là ond’ io vivendo mossi».
query.result:
**English:**
94 Who were you, and why do you have your backs turned 95 to the sun? Tell me, and if you want me to implore 96 something from where I moved while living."
**Malay:**
94 Siapakah kamu dan mengapa kamu membelakangi 95 matahari? Katakan padaku, dan jika kamu ingin aku memohon 96 sesuatu dari tempat aku bergerak saat hidup."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 Ed elli a me: «Perché i nostri diretri 98 rivolga il cielo a sé, saprai; ma prima 99 scias quod ego fui successor Petri.
query.result:
**English:**
97 And he to me: "Why our leaders 98 turn their gaze to themselves, you will know; but first 99 know that I was the successor of Peter.
**Malay:**
97 Dan dia kepadaku: "Mengapa para pemimpin kita 98 mengarahkan pandangan mereka kepada diri mereka sendiri, kamu akan tahu; tetapi pertama-tama 99 ketahuilah bahwa aku adalah pengganti Petrus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 Intra Sïestri e Chiaveri s’adima 101 una fiumana bella, e del suo nome 102 lo titol del mio sangue fa sua cima.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Between Sestri and Chiaveri flows 101 a beautiful river, and from its name 102 the title of my blood takes its source.
**Malay:**
100 Di antara Sestri dan Chiaveri mengalir 101 sebuah sungai yang indah, dan dari namanya 102 gelar darahku mengambil puncaknya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
103 Un mese e poco più prova’ io come 104 pesa il gran manto a chi dal fango il guarda, 105 che piuma sembran tutte l’altre some.
query.result:
**English:**
103 A month, and a little more, I experienced how 104 heavy the great cloak weighs on him who looks at it from the mud, 105 for all other burdens seem like feathers.
**Malay:**
103 Sebulan, dan sedikit lebih, aku mengalami bagaimana 104 beratnya jubah besar itu bagi orang yang melihatnya dari lumpur, 105 karena semua beban lainnya tampak seperti bulu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
106 La mia conversïone, omè!, fu tarda; 107 ma, come fatto fui roman pastore, 108 così scopersi la vita bugiarda.
query.result:
**English:**
106 My conversion, alas!, was late; 107 but, as soon as I became the Roman shepherd, 108 I discovered the deceitful life.
**Malay:**
106 Pertobatan, aduh!, lambat sekali; 107 tetapi, begitu aku menjadi gembala Romawi, 108 maka aku menemukan kehidupan yang penuh tipu daya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Vidi che lì non s’acquetava il core, 110 né più salir potiesi in quella vita; 111 per che di questa in me s’accese amore.
query.result:
**English:**
109 I saw that the heart found no peace there, 110 nor could it ascend any further in that life; 111 because of which love for this life was kindled in me.
**Malay:**
109 Aku melihat bahwa di sana hati tidak tenang, 110 dan tidak dapat lagi naik lebih tinggi dalam kehidupan itu; 111 karena itu cinta untuk kehidupan ini menyala dalam diriku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 Fino a quel punto misera e partita 113 da Dio anima fui, del tutto avara; 114 or, come vedi, qui ne son punita.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Up to that point, my soul was wretched and separated 113 from God, completely miserly; 114 now, as you see, I am punished here for it.
**Malay:**
112 Hingga saat itu, jiwaku sengsara dan terpisah 113 dari Tuhan, sama sekali kikir; 114 sekarang, seperti yang kau lihat, aku dihukum di sini karenanya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
115 Quel ch’avarizia fa, qui si dichiara 116 in purgazion de l’anime converse; 117 e nulla pena il monte ha più amara.
query.result:
**English:**
115 What avarice does is declared here 116 in the purgation of the conversing souls; 117 and the mountain has no punishment more bitter.
**Malay:**
115 Apa yang dilakukan oleh ketamakan, di sini dinyatakan 116 dalam penyucian jiwa-jiwa yang berbicara; 117 dan gunung itu tidak memiliki hukuman yang lebih pahit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 Sì come l’occhio nostro non s’aderse 119 in alto, fisso a le cose terrene, 120 così giustizia qui a terra il merse.
query.result:
**English:**
118 Just as our sight did not rise 119 upward, fixed on earthly things, 120 so justice here on earth struck him down.
**Malay:**
118 Sama seperti penglihatan kita tidak tertuju 119 ke atas, terpaku pada hal-hal duniawi, 120 maka keadilan di bumi ini menjatuhkannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 Come avarizia spense a ciascun bene 122 lo nostro amore, onde operar perdési, 123 così giustizia qui stretti ne tene,
124 ne’ piedi e ne le man legati e presi; 125 e quanto fia piacer del giusto Sire, 126 tanto staremo immobili e distesi».
query.result:
**English:**
121 As avarice quenched our love for every good, 122 whereby our actions were lost, 123 so justice here holds us fast,
124 bound and seized in our feet and hands; 125 and as long as it pleases the just Lord, 126 so long shall we remain motionless and outstretched.”
**Malay:**
121 Sebagaimana ketamakan memadamkan cinta kita terhadap setiap kebaikan, 122 yang karenanya tindakan kita menjadi sia-sia, 123 maka keadilan di sini menahan kita dengan erat,
124 terikat dan tertangkap di kaki dan tangan kita; 125 dan selama itu menyenangkan Tuhan yang adil, 126 selama itu kita akan tetap tidak bergerak dan terentang.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Io m’era inginocchiato e volea dire; 128 ma com’ io cominciai ed el s’accorse, 129 solo ascoltando, del mio reverire,
130 «Qual cagion», disse, «in giù così ti torse?».
query.result:
**English:**
127 I had knelt down and wanted to speak; 128 but as I began and he noticed, 129 just by listening, my reverence,
130 "What cause," he said, "bent you down so low?"
**Malay:**
127 Aku telah berlutut dan ingin berbicara; 128 tetapi ketika aku mulai dan dia menyadarinya, 129 hanya dengan mendengarkan, rasa hormatku,
130 "Sebab apa," katanya, "membuatmu membungkuk begitu rendah?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
131 E io a lui: «Per vostra dignitate 132 mia coscïenza dritto mi rimorse».
133 «Drizza le gambe, lèvati sù, frate!», 134 rispuose; «non errar: conservo sono 135 teco e con li altri ad una podestate.
query.result:
**English:**
131 And I to him: "For your dignity 132 my conscience rightly pricked me."
133 "Straighten your legs, get up, brother!" 134 he replied; "do not err: I am a guardian 135 with you and with the others to a single power.
**Malay:**
131 Dan aku kepadanya: "Demi martabatmu 132 hati nuraniku menegurku dengan tepat."
133 "Luruskan kakimu, berdirilah, saudara!" 134 jawabnya; "jangan salah: aku adalah penjaga 135 bersamamu dan dengan yang lain untuk satu kekuasaan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
136 Se mai quel santo evangelico suono 137 che dice ‘Neque nubent’ intendesti, 138 ben puoi veder perch’ io così ragiono.
query.result:
**English:**
136 If ever you understood that holy gospel sound 137 that says ‘They shall neither marry’, 138 you can clearly see why I reason thus.
**Malay:**
136 Jika engkau pernah mengerti bunyi injil yang kudus itu 137 yang mengatakan ‘Mereka tidak akan menikah’, 138 engkau dapat melihat dengan jelas mengapa aku beralasan demikian.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
139 Vattene omai: non vo’ che più t’arresti; 140 ché la tua stanza mio pianger disagia, 141 col qual maturo ciò che tu dicesti.
query.result:
**English:**
139 Go now: I do not want you to linger any longer; 140 for your presence makes my weeping difficult, 141 with which I ripen what you have said.
**Malay:**
139 Pergilah sekarang: aku tidak ingin kamu tinggal lebih lama lagi; 140 karena kehadiranmu membuat tangisku sulit, 141 yang dengannya aku matangkan apa yang telah kamu katakan.
